name: AWS
hint: Select the environment where you want to deploy Logz.io Telemetry Collector.

datasources.name: System
datasources.description: Logz.io Uses OpenTelemetry to monitor your EC2.

telemetries.hint: Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect logs from your EC2.

params.name: stringList
params.label: required
params.description: The pathss of log files to collect.
params.hint: By adding paths, OpenTelemetry will read logs from these log paths and will export them to Logz.io.

params.name: stringListnotrequired
params.label: not-required
params.description: The paths of log files to collect
params.hint: By adding paths, OpenTelemetry will read logs from these log paths and will export them to Logz.io.

params.name: stringListwithpattern
params.label: with pattern
params.description: The paths of log files to collect.
params.hint: By adding paths, OpenTelemetry will read logs from these log paths and will export them to Logz.io.

params.name: stringListwithpatternerror
params.label: with pattern error
params.description: The paths of log files to collect.
params.hint: By adding paths, OpenTelemetry will read logs from these log paths and will export them to Logz.io.

params.name: logSources
params.label: Location of your logs
params.description: The paths of log files to collect.
params.hint: By adding paths, OpenTelemetry will read logs from these log paths and will export them to Logz.io.

params.name: logSourcesnotrequired
params.label: Location of your logs
params.description: The paths of log files to collect.
params.hint: By adding paths, OpenTelemetry will read logs from these log paths and will export them to Logz.io.

telemetries.hint: Switch the toggle on if you want Logz.io Telemetry Collector to collect metrics from your EC2.
